meanings: (때·시기 등에 이르다) be, come, become; (나이가) reach, (formal) attain; (경과하다) pass
(동사적 명사에 붙어) become, get to be, be

examples.korean: We just had soup instead of a full meal. 발음듣기 우리는 제대로 된 식사 대신 수프만 먹었다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: We just had soup instead of a full meal. 발음

examples.korean: When are you going to get a proper job? 발음듣기 자네는 언제 제대로 된 직장을 잡을 건가? Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: When are you going to get a proper job? 발음

examples.korean: We now have a functioning shower. 발음듣기 우리는 이제 제대로 된 샤워 시설이 있다[제대로 샤워를 한다]. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: We now have a functioning shower. 발음

examples.korean: ‘Do you think they’ll win?’ ‘Do me a favour! They haven't got a single decent player.’ 발음듣기 “그들이 이길 것 같니?” “무슨 소릴 하는 거야! 그들은 제대로 된 선수 한 명 없다구.” Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: ‘Do you think they’ll win?’ ‘Do me a favour! They haven't got a single decent player.’ 발음

examples.korean: That’s not the right way to hold a pair of scissors. 발음듣기 그것은 가위를 잡는 바른[제대로 된] 방식이 아니다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: That’s not the right way to hold a pair of scissors. 발음
